GenAI Tutorial

Exploring Claude Projects

Learn how to create and use Projects within Claude

<= div>

Hey Santiago,

One of the worst AI experiences you can have is when you=E2= =80=99re deep within a project and want to use AI as a partner only to real= ize that you=E2=80=99ll first need to spend 10 minutes catching the model u= p on details you=E2=80=99ve already shared yesterday in a previous chat.

This is where Claude Projects come= in. Now, you only need to share your goals and= relevant files once <= span style="3D""">, and then you can have as many unique conversations about = them as you want, all within a single workspace<= b>.

In the simplest = terms, Claude Projects= are persistent, long-term workspaces that are focused= around a single task or topic. Instead of every new chat being an independ= ent, unique interaction, Projects allows you to create chats that already h= ave access to the necessary context. This includes uploaded documents, code= , and other files, as well as the full chat history of that project.=C2=A0<= span>

Core Capabili= ties:=C2=A0

  • Persistent Files: You only need to upload a file once within your project. They w= ill remain accessible to the model and can be referenced in all future chat= s within that project.=C2=A0

  • <= p style="3D"mso-line-height-alt:150.0%;padding:0px;text-align:left;word-brea=k:break-word;""> Conversational Memory: Claude remembers the entire history of all conve= rsations within a project.=C2=A0

  • Access Files using R= AG: Claude utilizes Retrieval-augmented generat= ion (RAG) to access massive amounts of content within responses without los= ing quality.=C2=A0

  • Organized Workspaces: Being someone who uses AI everyday, my chat history is incr= edibly unorganized. Luckily projects allow me to keep my chats organized.= =C2=A0

The beauty of Projects= is their versatility= . You can use them to organize a series of complex chats t= hat all reference the same codebase, or you could create a simple Project j= ust to keep your notes about a single book in one place. This flexibility m= akes Projects an incredibly powerful tool for anyone.

<= tr>

How to Create Your First Project

Now let=E2=80=99s quickly create our first project.= =C2=A0

  • Step 1 - Click on =E2=80=9CPr= ojects=E2=80=9D in the upper left corner.=C2=A0

  • Step 2 - Name your project and describe what you want to build. This= might just be a collection of similar chats or could be how you interact w= ith your work or school files.=C2=A0

=

This is where to name and describe your projec= t.

  • Step 3 - Add files and= instructions. Now that the project has been created, you can customize it.= Mainly this involves adding any files and custom instructions that you wan= t all future chats to have access to.=C2=A0

= =

The section on the right allows you to ad= d files and custom instructions for the project.

=

Step 4 - Start chatting. Now = that your project is set up, you can start working within it.=C2=A0 <= p>

Why Projects Are a Game-Chan= ger=C2=A0

Projects change the way we interac= t with AI chatbots like Claude. They are so impactful that they=E2=80=99ve = become a common feature across the AI ecosystem. ChatGPT, for example, has = a very similar feature that I love.=C2=A0

  • Time S= aver: Now you don=E2=80=99t need to spend 10 mi= nutes describing your goals every time you create a new chat. Instead just = create within the relevant project.

  • Better Answers:

    • Because the model has access to more information= (files + previous chats), you will get more accurate, context-aware respon= ses.=C2=A0

  • Stay Organized: You can easily find and interact with various projects in seconds.=C2=A0<= span>

  • Tackle Larger Tasks: Usin= g projects you can complete huge, complex tasks by breaking it into individ= ual chats without losing access to the relevant context.=C2=A0

  • Include / Use Artifacts: Anthropic ha= s ensured that you can use Artifacts within projects which means that you c= ould potentially create Artifacts specifically for a project.=C2=A0=C2=A0

    • Ultimately, Projects give you = more control and freedom over how you use AI in your long-term work.

    = <= h2 style="3D"color:#2A2A2A;font-weight:normal;mso-line-height-alt:150.0%;""> <= span style="3D""">Helpful Use Cases

    The best p= art about tools like Claude Projects is that they can help every user. Let= =E2=80=99s look at a few powerful use cases.=C2=A0

    • For Developers: You can u= pload a project or small code base and use Artifacts to help solve problems= , improve the code, or write documentation.=C2=A0

    • Fo= r Writers: Create a Project for your next artic= le or book. Upload the relevant research, notes, and writing examples and h= ave Claude play the role of writer or editor.

    • For Stu= dents: Upload notes and course work. You can th= en ask questions, create worksheets and example problems, or just have a pe= rsonal tutor.=C2=A0

    • For Everyone: Planning a trip? Preparing for a big purchase? Create a project = that keeps all your notes and thoughts organized.=C2=A0
